Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hocus \Ho"cus\, n. 1. One who cheats or deceives. --South. [1913 Webster]
2. Drugged liquor. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hocus \Ho"cus\, v. t. [See {Hocus-pocus}.] 1. To deceive or cheat. --Halliwell. [1913 Webster]
2. To adulterate; to drug; as, liquor is said to be hocused for the purpose of stupefying the drinker. --Dickens. [1913 Webster]
3. To stupefy with drugged liquor. --Thackeray. [1913 Webster]
